thread.title: Fall full of events at Orlando theme parks
thread.title_full: Fall full of events at Orlando theme parks

author: Dewayne Bevil
title: Fall full of events at Orlando theme parks
text:
Fall full of events at Orlando theme parks Caption Halloween Horror Nights 24 KEN KINZIE / UNIVERSAL ORLANDO Images from Halloween Horror Nights 24 at Universal Orlando. Images from Halloween Horror Nights 24 at Universal Orlando. (KEN KINZIE / UNIVERSAL ORLANDO) Caption Halloween Horror Nights 24 JAMES KILBY / UNIVERSAL ORLANDO Images from Halloween Horror Nights 24 at Universal Orlando. Images from Halloween Horror Nights 24 at Universal Orlando. (JAMES KILBY / UNIVERSAL ORLANDO) A look at what's coming this fall at the theme parks 
Slowly falling toward autumn 
Let's fast-forward a little for a fall theme-park preview. 
•Disney World gets the fastest start on trick-or-treating, debuting this year's version of Mickey's Not-So-Scary Halloween on Sept. 15. The after-hours, extra-ticket event runs 25 select nights through Nov. 1. The evenings include a special parade, shows and fireworks. Costumes are encouraged. Caption 2011 Epcot International Food & Wine Festival JOE BURBANK/ORLANDO SENTINEL From the new-for-2011 Hawaii Marketplace, a Kalua Pork Slider with sweet and sour Dole Pineapple Chutney and spicy mayonnaise; Tuna Poke with Seawood Salad and Lotus Root Chips, at Spaceship Earth with a glass of chilled chardonnay during the Orlando Sentinel's exclusive preview of the 2011 Epcot International Food & Wine Festival, in Lake Buena Vista, Thursday, Sept. 8, 2011. From the new-for-2011 Hawaii Marketplace, a Kalua Pork Slider with sweet and sour Dole Pineapple Chutney and spicy mayonnaise; Tuna Poke with Seawood Salad and Lotus Root Chips, at Spaceship Earth with a glass of chilled chardonnay during the Orlando Sentinel's exclusive preview of the 2011 Epcot International Food & Wine Festival, in Lake Buena Vista, Thursday, Sept. 8, 2011. (JOE BURBANK/ORLANDO SENTINEL) Caption 2011 Epcot International Food & Wine Festival JOE BURBANK/ORLANDO SENTINEL From the new-for-2011 Hawaii Marketplace, a Kalua Pork Slider with sweet and sour Dole Pineapple Chutney and spicy mayonnaise; Tuna Poke with Seawood Salad and Lotus Root Chips, with a glass of chilled chardonnay during the Orlando Sentinel's exclusive preview of the 2011 Epcot International Food & Wine Festival, in Lake Buena Vista, Thursday, Sept. 8, 2011. From the new-for-2011 Hawaii Marketplace, a Kalua Pork Slider with sweet and sour Dole Pineapple Chutney and spicy mayonnaise; Tuna Poke with Seawood Salad and Lotus Root Chips, with a glass of chilled chardonnay during the Orlando Sentinel's exclusive preview of the 2011 Epcot International Food & Wine Festival, in Lake Buena Vista, Thursday, Sept. 8, 2011. (JOE BURBANK/ORLANDO SENTINEL) See more galleries 
•Universal marks the 25th year of Halloween Horror Nights with a record nine haunted houses beginning Sept. 18. The event, which will feature the return of the iconic Jack the Clown, runs for 30 select nights — another record — through Nov. 1. HHN is an after-hours, extra-ticket occasion. 
•The 20th annual Epcot International Food and Wine Festival begins Sept. 25. New elements this year include two marketplaces in Future World tied to ABC's "The Chew" (which will be taping shows Oct. 7-9), a Remy-hosted culinary scavenger hunt and the return of the cranberry bog. The event runs daily through Nov. 16. The fest is included in regular Epcot admission.
